Employee Applicant Privacy NoticeWho we are:Shape a brighter financial future with us.Together with our members, we‚Äôre changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance.We‚Äôre a next-generation fintech company using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we‚Äôre at the forefront. We‚Äôre proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people‚Äôs lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world.The roleSoFi‚Äôs Credit team manages credit risk activities for our lending products (Student Loan Refinance, Private Student Loan, Personal Loan, Credit Card, and Mortgage) - including credit strategies/policies for new account origination, income and employment verification, portfolio management, collections/recovery strategies and operations, and risk and operational data science and analytics. The team designs data-driven strategies to ensure the growth in lending is consistent with the company‚Äôs risk appetite and helps create the products and experiences that put our members‚Äô interests first.The Senior Credit Strategy Analyst / Senior Data Scientist will work in the Credit team and have responsibilities to analyze and evaluate data to develop and propose value-added credit risk strategies for SoFi‚Äôs lending products, including Personal Loan, Student Loan Refinance, Private Student Loan, and Credit Card. The initial focus of the role will be on income and employment verification strategy for Personal Loan, Student Loan Refinance, and Private Student Loan, but the candidate may get opportunities to work on other functions in the future.The Senior Credit Strategy Analyst / Senior Data Scientist will collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Business Units, Capital Markets, Product, and Engineering, and use business knowledge and quantitative and analytical skills to drive revenue, control risk, and provide value to the company and consumers.The ideal candidate will possess a data-driven analytics background and the strategic acumen to direct a function that draws strategic insights from data using database and statistical analysis tools to inform decisions and support SoFi‚Äôs overarching strategic goals relative to loss prevention and profit optimization. They bring new ways of thinking, data sources, technologies, and capabilities to SoFi.What you‚Äôll do: Innovate‚Ä¶ Bring your brightest ideas to building risk strategies. This means you will architect the pre-screen, underwriting, and income/employment verification strategies. Data Driven‚Ä¶ Your deep analysis will power the future of lending with an optimal real-time data ecosystem ‚Äì including multi-product internal, bureau, third-party, and alternative data sources and uses. Iterate, learn, innovate‚Ä¶ We are all responsible for innovation and must embrace data-driven decisions.Control the Risk and Drive Performance Outcomes ‚Ä¶ Understand credit risk and develop approaches to mitigate loss and responsibly grow revenue. Monitor the performance of strategies and portfolios. Document and communicate results and escalate issues as necessary. Identify gaps/opportunities and drive actions. Grow, Grow, Grow!‚Ä¶ Be inspired by dynamic leaders and our rapidly growing business. We want YOU to be an inspired leader of tomorrow, so we are recruiting the best, brightest, and passionately quantitative team members.What you‚Äôll need:4+ years of related experienceBusiness acumen and work experience in the consumer lending business (loans or credit cards)Direct experience in the credit strategy analytical life cycle, including strategy and decision tree development, presentation, implementation validation, and post-implementation monitoringProven analytical skills in conducting sophisticated analysis using customer performance data, bureau attributes, and other 3rd party variables to solve business problemsProficient skills in Excel, SQL, and PythonA demonstrated ability to synthesize and communicate analysis to business partners and senior managementHigh motivation to drive results, eager to learn, and able to work collaboratively in a fluid environmentKnowledge/skills in analytical and modeling techniques such as Decision Trees, regression, logistic regression, A/B Testing, and TableauPreferred: 4+ years of consumer lending credit strategy work experience; income/employment verification expertise is a plusPreferred: Experience in analyzing and testing credit strategies or models to meet the fair lending requirementsPreferred: Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or PhD) with a quantitative major such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Computer ScienceCompensation And BenefitsThe base pay range for this role is listed below. Final base pay offer will be determined based on individual factors such as the candidate‚Äôs experience, skills, and location.To view all of our comprehensive and competitive benefits, visit our Benefits at SoFi page!SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.New York applicants: Notice of Employee RightsSoFi is committed to embracing diversity. As part of this commitment, SoFi offers reasonable accommodations to candidates with physical or mental disabilities. If you need accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email accommodations@sofi.com.Due to insurance coverage issues, we are unable to accommodate remote work from Hawaii or Alaska at this time.Internal EmployeesIf you are a current employee, do not apply here - please navigate to our Internal Job Board in Greenhouse to apply to our open roles.

Rex is an ecosystem that incubates, launches and operates tech startups across a number of sectors at the intersection of technology and real estate: Services, FinTech, InsureTech, Data Services, and more. natural language understanding modelsWork across Rex companies to implement new features related to machine learning and engineer real-time data pipelines to incorporate them into the company‚Äôs modelsApply research and existing academic work to real-life problemsWrite production quality code, scale solutions for high-throughput and low-latency requirementsImplement model observability and system performanceCollaborate with product, design and user research partners as well as the data engineers in the Rex Ecosystem companies to design and architect innovative machine learning solutions to improve the customer experienceWhat You Offer3+ years of experience as machine learning engineer or applied machine learning scientistExperience with machine learning pipelines and concepts such as large-scale training, batch feature extraction, real-time serving platformsExperience with common ML/NLP libraries experience with BERT, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, KerasExperience with machine learning techniques and advanced analytics (e.g. regression, classification, clustering, time series, causal inference, text analytics)Experience working with datasets that reflect real life problems such as noisy, highly imbalanced datasetsPassion for working and learning in a fast-growing companyBefore you apply, review these resources to better understand our culture and mission:Rex ecosystem initiativesRex news & Op-EdsWhat We OfferCompetitive salary and early-in equity awardsCompetitive and comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plansPeace of mind through company-paid short-term disability, long-term disability and life insurance401(K) with employer matchUnlimited (discretionary) PTO in addition to Holidays and your birthday offMonthly gym membership stipendHealth Savings Account with employer contributionDependent Flexible Spending AccountMental health telecounseling optionsWe are committed to serving others with a focus on faith, family, and freedomFrom the top-down, Job DescriptionSummary: The Analytics & Insights team has been a key contributor to driving Domino‚Äôs industry-leading growth by pairing strategic thought leadership with the latest analytic techniques in the fields of data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and primary research. The A&I team leverages their skills to drive outstanding consumer and employee experiences to fuel future growth.The Innovation Data Science team works to create best-in-class technology-driven customer and team member experiences in & around stores and during delivery by continuously testing new concepts, platforms, and technologies. As a data scientist on this team, you will work cross-functionally with the digital innovation, technology, and operations innovation teams to identify opportunities for innovative tech solutions and generate insights that inform our national marketing campaigns. Leveraging your knowledge of statistics and machine learning, combined with creative analytical thinking and the ability to identify actionable business recommendations will enable us to continue to build Domino‚Äôs techquity. You will be solving difficult, non-routine problems and developing the machine learning and artificial intelligence components of Domino‚Äôs next-generation smart applications.For this role, we are seeking a creative problem solver with strong analytic and programming skills. The candidate should be skilled in using multiple data sources, SQL, Python, and machine learning algorithms. The ideal candidate will need to collaborate on advanced machine learning model design and testing and have strong communication skills to interpret model results and impacts for our clients. This role will also require partnering with IT specialists on data/model staging, integrating with existing platforms, and improving technical and operational algorithm/data uses. Candidate will design and build simulation experiments to model and optimize business and operations processes.Responsibilities And DutiesDevelop a strong understanding of the business, the challenges, and demonstrate the ability to identify business opportunities that can be acted uponResearch, develop, and implement advanced machine learning solutions and statistical analysis techniques to solve complex business problems, provide meaningful recommendations and actionable strategies to internal stakeholdersSimulate, analyze, and optimize operations processes using AnyLogic, Python, and ROwn data science & analytical solutions end-to-end, from identifying business problems, crafting ML-based solutions, socializing proposed architecture with partners, implementing solutions, tracking results, and presenting to stakeholdersConsult and share novel approaches of machine learning with other team membersEfficiently prioritize competing tasks in dynamic business environmentDevelop, train, and test models for object detection, classification, and segmentation on images of different quality including noisy and low-quality imagesServe as a mentor and consultant guiding best practices in code review, data processing, modeling, AI, and ML developmentUse visualization, reporting and other tools to improve the ways in which our team accesses and interprets datasetsQualificationsBachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field4+ years of experience in a quantitative or technical work environmentStrong experience solving business problems with data science, emphasis on business outcomesProficient in SQLProficient in R or PythonKnowledge of a variety of predictive modeling, machine learning and generative AI techniques (classification, predictive, artificial neural networks, image recognition, LLMs, etc.) and their real-world applicationKnowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, probability, properties of distributions, statistical tests, etc.) and experience with applicationsAbility to self-start and self-direct work in a dynamic, cross-functional environmentExcellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and encourage partners and team members to drive collaboration and alignmentExperience creating engaging and compelling stories and presentations from data and effectively communicating analysis results with a diverse non-technical audienceThe following are a plus but not required:Master‚Äôs degree in related fieldExperience designing, building, and evaluating simulation models in AnyLogic or similar toolsExperience with JavaAbility to quickly learn and apply new programming languages, technologies, and frameworksAdditional InformationThis role is onsite in Ann Arbor, MI and will require full relocation for non-local candidatesAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Position Overview:Here at ShyftLabs, we are searching for an experienced Data Scientist who can derive performance improvement and cost efficiency in our product through a deep understanding of the ML and infra system, and provide a data driven insight and scientific solution.ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.Job Responsibilities:Data Analysis and research: analyzing a large dataset with queries and scripts, extracting valuable signals out of noise, and producing actionable insights into how we could complete and improve a complex ML and bidding system.Simulation and Modelling: validating and quantifying the efficiency and performance gain from hypotheses through rigorous simulation and modelling.Experimentation and Causal Inference: developing a robust experiment design and metric framework, and providing reliable and unbiased insights for product and business decision making.Basic Qualifications:Master's degree in a quantitative discipline or equivalent.5+ years minimum of relevant professional experience.Distinctive problem-solving skills, good at articulating product questions, pulling data from large datasets and using statistics to arrive at a recommendation.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to present information and analysis results effectively.Ability to build positive relationships within ShyftLabs and with our stakeholders, and work effectively with cross-functional partners in a global company.Statistics: must have strong knowledge and experience in experimental design, hypothesis testing, and various statistical analysis techniques such as regression or linear models.Machine Learning: must have deep understanding of ML algorithms (i.e. deep learning, random forest, gradient boosted trees, k-means clustering, etc.) and its development, validation, and evaluation.Programming: experience with Python, R or other scripting language, and database language (e.g. SQL) or data manipulation (e.g. Pandas).We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is able to be fully remote anywhere within the United States. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.ShyftLabs is an equal-opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

Description: This is a remote position.Job Title: Data Scientist (Entry Level)Location of client: Phoenix, Arizona.Employment Type: Full-TimeSalary: $60,000 - $70,000 per annumExperience Required: Minimum 1 year of project experienceHow to Apply: visit hiremefast.net  to learn more & apply with your resume and cover letter there on the website.About us: HireMeFast is a leading staffing and recruitment agency specializing in connecting businesses with top-tier talent across various industries. Develop algorithms iteratively, building in the right level of complexity to solve the business problem at hand and support future improvements. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world.The roleSoFi‚Äôs Credit team manages credit risk activities for our lending products (Student Loan Refinance, Private Student Loan, Personal Loan, Credit Card, and Mortgage) - including credit strategies/policies for new account origination and portfolio management, collections/recovery strategies and operations, and risk and operational data science and analytics. The initial focus of the role will be on Student Loan Refinance but the candidate may get opportunities to work on other lending products in the future.The Senior Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Business Units, Capital Markets, Product and Engineering, and use business knowledge and quantitative and analytical skills to drive revenue, control risk, and provide value to the company and consumers.The ideal candidate will possess a data-driven analytics background and the strategic acumen to direct a function that draws strategic insights from data using database and statistical analysis tools to inform decisions and support SoFi‚Äôs overarching strategic goals relative to loss prevention and profit optimization. They bring new ways of thinking, data sources, technologies, and capabilities to SoFi.What you‚Äôll do: Innovate‚Ä¶ Bring your brightest ideas to building risk strategies. This means you will architect the pre-screen and underwriting strategies. Data Driven‚Ä¶ Your deep analysis will power the future of lending with an optimal real-time data ecosystem ‚Äì including multi-product internal, bureau, third-party, and alternative data sources and uses. Iterate, learn, innovate‚Ä¶ We are all responsible for innovation and must embrace data-driven decisions.Control the Risk and Drive Performance Outcomes ‚Ä¶ Understand credit risk and develop approaches to mitigate loss and responsibly grow revenue. Monitor the performance of strategies and portfolios. Document and communicate results and escalate issues as necessary. Identify gaps/opportunities and drive actions. Grow, Grow, Grow!‚Ä¶ Be inspired by dynamic leaders and our rapidly growing business. Our vision is to build the next generation platform to enable easy and fast creation of audio and video content powered by cutting-edge AI. Building a revolutionary way to record, transcribe, edit, and mix spoken audio and video comes with a series of unique challenges and requires solving hard and complex problems.As a founding product data scientist on the team, you will play a critical role in shaping our growth strategy, up-leveling our experimentation culture, and scaling our business.What You'll DoConduct in-depth analysis to shape product PLG motion and B2B strategy. Develop deep understanding of the product ecosystem and identify opportunities to drive activation, engagement, and monetization through actionable insights. Improve execution rigor of product teams by owning success metrics and opportunity sizing. Brain buddy with product and engineering teams for day-to-day experiment design, deployment, and analysis. Provide creative solutions for tricky experimentation scenarios. Evolve experimentation culture and practices within the company. What You Bring4‚Äì7 years of experience in a Data Scientist or similar role. 3+ years working in a growth function. Strong business and product intuition to identify opportunities in the growth ecosystem. Strong knowledge of statistical analysis and A/B tests. Strong SQL skills and proficient in at least one programming language such as Python or R. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Curiosity, savviness to navigate in a dynamic environment, and a growth mindset. Having worked at a fast-growing start-up is a plus. The base salary range for this role is $150,000- $190,000/year. Final offer amounts will carefully consider multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise, location, and may vary from the amount above.About DescriptDescript is building a simple, intuitive, fully-powered editing tool for video and audio ‚Äî an editing tool built for the age of AI. We are a team of 125 ‚Äî with a proven CEO and the backing of some of the world's greatest investors (OpenAI, Andreessen Horowitz, Redpoint Ventures, Spark Capital).Descript is the special company that's in possession of both product market fit and the raw materials (passionate user community, great product, large market) for growth, but is still early enough that each new employee has a measurable influence on the direction of the company.Benefits include a generous healthcare package, catered lunches, and flexible vacation time. We currently have offices in San Francisco and Montreal, and are open to folks working remotely between PT and ET time zones. Whether you love WFH or can't wait to get back to being in person, we're interested in offering an environment that works for you.Descript is an equal opportunity workplace‚Äîwe are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We believe in actively building a team rich in diverse backgrounds, experiences, and opinions to better allow our employees, products, and community to thrive.

DescriptionResponsibilities:Key ResponsibilitiesPackage Development: Develop a package for client to execute Reinforcement Learning (RL) on AWS Sagemaker. The package should allow for the use of multiple agents and allow for easy implementation of agents across different problems. client needs the ability to deploy multiple agents to solve problems mainly for portfolio management purposes. Deploy the building blocks of a reinforcement learning problem to clients data packages. Code should be modular. Strong acumen for OOP preferred. Package should address complex multi-agent problems which are common in portfolio optimization. Package should have functionality for the evaluation of models, hyper-parameter optimization, model/scenario explainability, and the display of results to the trading team. Experience in Quantitative trading or deploying RL for similar optimization problems required.Proof of Concept Deployment: Design, implement, and evaluate the RL package on a POC after package deployment.Qualifications Education: Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Financial Engineering, Operations Research or a related field. Experience: At least 5 years of professional experience in reinforcement learning deploying models at scale on AWS required. Experience contributing to building python packages in RL or other ML fields preferred. Prior model deployments with a specific focus on applications in quantitative trading or portfolio management preferred. Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python and familiarity with popular RL libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and OpenAI Gym. Must also have a familiarity with cloud platforms deploying and training RL models (AWS Sagemaker). Software Engineering Skills: Solid grasp of software design principles, data structures, and algorithms pertinent to trading environments. Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to relay complex trading strategies and outcomes to various stakeholders. Teamwork: Demonstrated experience working effectively in cross-functional teams, especially within a high-pressure trading context.Nice-to-Have Experience with high-frequency trading environments. Publications or notable contributions in the realm of RL for quantitative finance.Education: Bachelors Degree

About AttainBuilt for consumers and companies, alike. In a world driven by data, we believe consumers and businesses can coexist. Our founders had a vision to empower consumers to leverage their greatest asset‚Äîtheir data‚Äîin exchange for modern financial services. Built with this vision in mind, our platform allows consumers to access savings tools, earned wages and rewards without cost or hidden fees. In exchange, they give permission to use their real-time data for research, insights and targeted advertising.At Attain, your contribution will help us build a more equitable and efficient data sharing ecosystem‚Äîwhether helping consumers access modern financial services or businesses leverage data to achieve better outcomes. You'll have the opportunity to work directly with hands-on leaders and mission-driven individuals everyday.This role will be on a hybrid schedule (3-days per week in office; 2-days per week remote) based in Redwood City, CA. About The RoleWe are seeking a Data Scientist to join our growing engineering team to play a key role in driving forward our data science and machine learning initiatives across the organization, within our flagship consumer application, Klover. This role will support continuous improvements to areas such as our cash advance underwriting model, our collections methodology, as well as help develop models to improve user retention and reduce churn. Our Data Science team has a direct impact on the data-driven initiatives across Attain. You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop advanced analytics and machine learning techniques.Preferred Qualifications4+ years of experience working in the financial technology space in either data science or analyticsBachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, information management or other related fieldProficiency in languages such as SQL, Python and/or R; data visualization tools such as Looker; and machine learning frameworks such as Vertex AIKnowledge and experience working with Google Cloud Platform suite (e.g. BigQuery, Vertex AI)Proven expertise in leveraging data analytics tools, techniques, and technologies to extract insights and drive data-informed decision-makingExcellent problem-solving skills with the ability to approach complex business challenges from a data-driven perspectiveDemonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentWhat a Typical Week Might Look LikeWork in close partnership with engineering, product & finance to make data-driven decisions and provide actionable recommendations on how our collections process should evolveOrganize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of data and information with attention to detail and accuracyWork in SQL to write efficient and well-structured queries on large data-setsCollaborate with other teams to integrate data science solutions into existing systems and infrastructure. Stay abreast of emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in data analytics to identify innovative opportunitiesAt the end of your first year, you'll have helped usIdentify optimization opportunities across our underwriting and collections processesTransform complex datasets into impactful stories with clear and actionable insightsWe're excited to hear from you. At Attain, we are passionate about finding people to continuously help us grow our organization. We encourage you to apply, even if your experience doesn't match every detail of the job description. If we don't see something that immediately fits, we will keep your resume on file for future opportunities.

About Nucleix:Nucleix is at the forefront of advancing medical diagnostics. Our innovative assay technology is contributing to new standards in lung cancer screening, aiming towards a future where early detection is the norm, not the exception. Our mission, while ambitious, has a deeply meaningful impact. We aim to detect lung cancer at its earliest stages with just a single tube of blood, striving to make healthcare more accessible to all. The journey at Nucleix is not only about the blend of rigorous science and novel technology in our assay, but also about our dedicated team members who are committed to changing the course of lung cancer diagnosis.As we progress, we are in search of a Data Scientist to play a pivotal role in this significant mission. You will be part of efforts centered around groundbreaking medical innovations, contributing tangibly to the global fight against lung cancer. The work, while demanding, is immensely rewarding with every project aimed at exploring the extents of what‚Äôs achievable in cancer screening.You have a solid mathematical foundation and adeptness in deploying the machine learning techniques. You know the classics like SVM or XGBoost, but you also know that ‚Äúattention is all you need‚Äù. For you LLM‚Äôs are not a threat but an opportunity to be more efficient and creative.At Nucleix, you'll immerse yourself in a stimulating environment alongside some of the brightest minds in the field. Our team is a hub of innovation, each member contributing a wealth of expertise and a relentless drive for exploration and excellence. In our culture of open collaboration and continuous learning, every voice is valued. The accessibility of senior management, including the CEO, fosters a conducive environment for sharing ideas and insights. Your contributions will not only be recognized but will play a critical role in advancing our mission, making a lasting impact in the global fight against lung cancer.¬†¬†--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------¬†Key Responsibilities:Spearhead the creation and implementation of AI and ML strategies and algorithms aimed at identifying markers and marker panels for future clinical tests.Innovate and implement effective data visualization techniques for both internal and external stakeholders.Conduct ad-hoc data analyses to glean critical insights that propel our mission forward.Champion projects from inception through to fruition, ensuring alignment with defined requirements and seamless implementation.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (Software, Research, Product Development, Clinical, Quality, and Regulatory) to understand project requisites and drive implementation.Initiate and lead regular stakeholder meetings to advance project objectives, ensuring timely updates to management on project status, progress, and challenges.Ensure projects are on schedule, meet defined requirements, and are well-documented in compliance with Nucleix‚Äôs Quality Management System.¬†Qualifications:MSc. in Computer Science / Physics / Mathematics / EngineeringBSc. Candidates with extensive experience and knowledge will also be considered3+ years‚Äô industry experience as a data scientist / bioinformatician working on biological dataProven expertise in developing machine learning models with a strong mathematical foundation.Fluid in the main data science languages and tools (i.e. Python, R, SQL, Tensorflow)Solid knowledge of cloud environments such as Amazon's AWSExperience in data visualization and conducting comprehensive data analyses.Expertise in NGS data and pipelines is a plusAbility to collaborate and communicate effectively across multidisciplinary teams.Exceptional organizational skills with a keen eye for detail.

Job Title: Senior Data ScientistLocation: Menlo Park, CA, USOur MissionTo build a viable long-lasting health care organization that assumes full responsibility for designing, developing, trial enrollment, regulatory approval and commercializing patient, physician, caregiver, payor, and societal friendly medicinal therapy intended to improve quality of life, increase potential duration of life and resolve serious medical healthcare needs. We Plan To Initiate Phase-III Clinical Studies In The Following NSCLC IndicationsIvonescimab combined with chemotherapy in patients with epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR)-mutated, locally advanced or metastatic non-squamous NSCLC who have progressed after treatment with a third-generation EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) (‚ÄúHARMONi‚Äù)Ivonescimab combined with chemotherapy in first-line metastatic squamous NSCLC patients (‚ÄúHARMONi-3‚Äù)Ivonescimab is an investigational therapy that is not approved by any regulatory authority. It is currently being investigated in Phase III clinical studies.Overview Of RoleThe Senior Data Scientist will be responsible for utilizing R/Shiny and Python to develop dashboards for real-time data visualization and analytics. The role encompasses activities for clinical trial data collection, analysis, reporting, and visualization across all Summit drugs. This role involves close collaboration with statisticians, data management, clinicians, medical writers, medical affairs, and other key members within Summit's regulatory team.Role And ResponsibilitiesUtilize R and Shiny for developing dashboards and data visualizations.Implement AI/ML techniques to explore potential tools that can improve the company's process and efficiency.Perform data analysis using R/Python/SAS language for summary and interpretation of clinical trial data.Publish R packages to internal company repository.Work closely with Biostatistician to implement CDISC SDTM and ADAM specification datasets. Experience working with Oncology trials preferred.Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Biostatistics, statistics, computer science or related field.Strong R and SAS programming skills, along with experience with R packages like dplyr, ggplot2, Shiny, etc.Hands-on experience with AI/ML techniques and Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLM).Hands-on experience in creating web apps using R, R Shiny, and Python, along with a strong grasp of how to manipulate data in R.Good understanding of CDISC standards including (SDTM and ADaM).Good understanding and hands on experience on programming support for data monitoring and data clean/query process.Good understanding on clinical data coding dictionaries (MedDRA and WHODD).While not required, a strong background in SAS programming is a plus.Demonstrated satisfactory ability to interpret statistical analysis results.Working knowledge of current regulatory requirements and guidance with deep understanding on clinical trial compliance requirement.NDA submission experience is a plus.The ability to work well under pressure and shifting priorities, both as a team leader and as a team member.The ability to plan, execute and manage project resources, timeline and delivery with good skill on setting priorities.Ability to proactively identify and address project uncertainties to minimize risk.Strong problem solving and analytical skills.Ability to communicate clearly both oral and written.

At Janus, we believe in a world where healthcare functions efficiently. Join us on our mission to improve the lives of administrative workers and fundamentally change the way work is done. Our team is building a world-class process improvement platform to help healthcare providers generate more cash with fewer resources.SummaryWe are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our team. Our Data Scientists are responsible for analyzing complex data sets, developing statistical models, and providing valuable insights to drive informed business decisions. Our Data Scientists ensure a complete delivery of all work, including scripts and pipelines for running models continuously. This role works closely with product and engineering teams to develop an understanding of our needs and convert user stories into technical requirements. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, and programming, along with a passion for solving real-world problems using data-driven approaches.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and develop data-driven solutions. Analyze large, complex datasets using statistical techniques and data mining algorithms to uncover patterns, trends, and insights. Develop and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analysis methods to solve business problems and optimize processes. Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency. Interpret and communicate analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. Collaborate with data engineers and IT professionals to ensure the availability, quality, and integrity of data. Continuously improve and refine existing models and analytical processes to enhance their accuracy and efficiency. Work on multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet project deadlines. Qualifications1-3 years of relevant work experience as Data Scientist or similar role, preferably in healthcare. Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. Strong knowledge of statistical concepts and techniques, including regression analysis, hypothesis testing, and experimental design. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, along with experience with relevant libraries and frameworks (e.g., NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow). Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and SQL for data manipulation and extraction. Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) is a plus. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and creatively to tackle complex problems. Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work. Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment. We know that potential candidates are often less likely to apply to a position if they don't match 100% of the job qualifications. Don't let that be why you miss out on this opportunity! We encourage you to apply if you can demonstrate many of these skills and competencies. Care For The Whole PersonAt Janus, our commitment is to provide each employee with what they need to be successful. Our benefits package has been designed in a thoughtful way that allows our employees to be happy, healthy and whole. Here are a few things we offer:We contribute 100% of base plan (HDHP) medical premiums for employees and 50% of premiums for family members. There are other options available as well. We contribute 75% of premiums for dental and vision insurance for employee-only plans. We have an employee assistance program that allows you the chance to work through any issues that may arise with the appropriate professional. We have a 401k plan with minimal portfolio fees, traditional and roth options, as well as rollovers and loan capabilities. We offer stock options to share in the value we create and in the ownership of Janus, so let's make it something that we are proud of. We offer unlimited PTO because we want our employees to take the time they need to rejuvenate and relax. At minimum, encourage all employees to take at least 15 fully unplugged days off each year. We encourage sacred moments that are free from distractions and allow you to create a connection with someone or something that is meaningful to you. We provide a monthly allowance to cover the cost related to working in a remote environment like upgraded internet or to offset your cell phone bill. We offer parental leave because bonding with your newest addition is so important! We have caregiving leave for our employees that are the primary caregiver for a loved one and needs time to care for that person. We want you to look for personal enrichment opportunities and will give you up to $500 per year to invest in yourself. We want you to be the best version of you and take time to do things you enjoy!We encourage on-going training, additional certifications and professional development related to your role and will review all requests for additional growth (including travel). We have committees focused on organizational initiatives to increase employee happiness and the recruitment and retention of a broad, inclusive workforce that represents a diverse range of interests, abilities, talents, and cultures. You are welcome to join!We have a benefits summary for you to review and will send more comprehensive information with your offer letter. If you want to review it sooner, just let us know!Equal Opportunity StatementJanus is an equal opportunity employer. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds and appreciate our differences. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, ancestry, sex, gender identity and expression, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, languages spoken, veteran status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and beliefs.We consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.Further, consistent with applicable federal and state law, Janus provides reasonable accommodations when requested by qualified applicants or employees with disabilities, unless doing so would cause an undue hardship. Janus' policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please contact the People team.E-VerifyThis employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the I-9 Form.

The team designs data-driven strategies to ensure the growth in lending is consistent with the company‚Äôs risk appetite and helps create the products and experiences that put our members‚Äô interests first.The Senior Credit Strategy Analyst / Senior Data Scientist will work in the Credit team and have responsibilities to analyze and evaluate data to develop and propose value-added credit risk strategies and models for SoFi‚Äôs lending products, including Personal Loan, Student Loan Refinance, Private Student Loan, and Credit Card.
